required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Acne Detection Software (AcneDect); AcneDect: a Software to Detect Acne Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to create a self-learning software that can detect acne lesions. Patients take a picture of their face every single day for 3 months with a secure mobile phone and fill out a pre-designed questionnaire. After 3 months, the mobile will be collected back and the pictures will be evaluated by 3 dermatologists. The software is able to learn from the dermatologists' evaluation and -using machine learning- a mechanism that should be able to automatically detect acne to some extent will be established.

primary_outcome.measure: Pictures to train the AcneDect software
primary_outcome.time_frame: every single day from baseline for 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Collection of pictures to train the AcneDect software to detect change in acne lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: AcneDect questionnaire regarding acne burden (Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) scale ranging from "Not bad at all" to "Very bad")
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every single day from baseline for 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Collection of patient reported outcomes via a mobile electronic case report form

intervention.intervention_name: Self- learning software that can detect acne lesions
intervention.description: Self- learning software that can detect acne lesions from patients who take a picture of their face every single day for 3 months with a secure mobile phone.
Collection of patient reported outcomes and clinical data via a mobile electronic case report form

study_pop.textblock: Patients within the consultation service of Dermatologische Klinik, Universitätsspital Basel, that meet the inclusion criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acne vulgaris
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to participate

overall_official.last_name: Alexander A. Navarini, Prof. Dr. MD
